cleaned_text: know that there are over 400,000 species of plants on our planet? However, we tend to eat just 200 different plant species, even though the number of edible plants for human consumption is a thousand times higher. For [#InternationalPlantAppreciationDay](https://www.linkedin.com/signup/cold-join?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Ffeed%2Fhashtag%2Finternationalplantappreciationday&trk=public_post_reshare-text), we are reminded of our responsibility to ensure the regeneration of landscapes within our agricultural systems, and to preserve plants and seed diversity. At the heart of biodynamic farming is the coexistence of humans and nature, the respect and care of plants, seen as a gift from nature to humanity. Whether it is to grow healthy produce or to preserve biodiversity, we believe in appreciating the gift of both wild and cultivated species.
